line_1: All orders of mankind are fools, or knaves:
line_2: To Mammon, or to Superstition slaves,

line_1: To keep a race of flickering knaves,
line_2: He grows himself the worst of slaves.

line_1: Saints, martyrs, fathers, all call'd fools, and knaves.
line_2: When all church-power is thought to make men slaves,

line_1: Bring none to light but honourable Knaves;
line_2: Shut up the Peasants in their mouldy Graves:
Look down and pity gilded slaves,

line_1: Intriguing Friends and well dissembl'd Knaves,
line_2: Who, tho' encircl'd by their shining Slaves,
